description: End of class quiz for Sessions 6 & 7: If, Elif, Else statements

questions.question: What keyword starts a conditional block in Python?
questions.explanation: 'if' is used to start a conditional statement that runs code only when a condition is True.

questions.question: How does Python know which code belongs inside an if block?
questions.explanation: Python uses indentation (usually 4 spaces) to define code blocks under if, elif, else.

questions.question: What happens if the condition in an if statement is False?
options: It runs the else block automatically
questions.explanation: If the condition is False, Python skips the indented code under if and moves on.

questions.question: What is the purpose of 'else'?
options: To run code when the if condition is False
questions.explanation: 'else' catches all cases where the if (and any elif) conditions were False.

questions.question: What does 'elif' stand for?
questions.explanation: 'elif' is short for 'else if'â€”it checks another condition if the previous ones were False.

questions.question: When is an elif block executed?
options: When its condition is True and previous if/elif were False
When the if condition is True
questions.explanation: elif runs only if its condition is True AND all previous if/elif conditions were False.

questions.question: Which is the correct syntax for an if statement?
questions.explanation: Python uses colon after condition and indentation for the block. Option B is correct shorthand for one line.

questions.question: In if-elif-else, how many blocks can execute?
questions.explanation: Only one block runsâ€”the first True condition in if/elif chain, or else if all are False.

questions.question: You check if temperature > 30: print('Hot'). Temperature is 25. What prints?
questions.explanation: 25 > 30 is False, so the if block is skipped. No output.

questions.question:
Code: if score >= 90: grade='A'
elif score >= 80: grade='B'
else: grade='C'
Score=85. What is grade?
questions.explanation: 85 >= 90 is False, 85 >= 80 is True, so elif runs and grade='B'.

questions.question: What is a nested if?
questions.explanation: A nested if is an if statement inside another if/else blockâ€”checking conditions within conditions.

questions.question: How do you check if age is between 13 and 19 inclusive in an if?
questions.explanation: All three are valid Python ways to check if age is 13-19.

questions.question: What's wrong? if x = 5: print('Five')
questions.explanation: = assigns, == compares. In conditions, you need comparison.

questions.question: You want free shipping if order > 50 OR member=True. Which condition is correct?
questions.explanation: OR means either condition being True qualifies for free shipping.

questions.question: Why use elif instead of multiple if statements?
options: elif ensures only one block runs for exclusive options
questions.explanation: elif links conditionsâ€”once one is True, the rest are skipped. Separate ifs would all be checked.

title: Sessions 6 & 7: If, Elif, Else - End of Class Quiz
